Location: West Conshohocken, PA
Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)

GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. Summary of Role\:

  • Implement automation script based on LVS team requests SPECs

  • Fluency in English Language – written & verbal 

Preferred Qualifications\:

  • Previous Semiconductor experience
  • Knowledge of DRC/LVS/CDSLIB/PEX EDA tools
  • Programming knowledge using skill
  • Demonstrated machine learning experience

Noblis works with a wide range of government clients in the defense, intelligence and federal civil sectors. Learn more at Noblis -About Us

 

Why work at a Noblis company?

Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. Noblis has won numerous workplace awards. Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace.

Responsibilities

Noblis is looking for technical interns for our 2022 Summer Internship Program!

Our 2022 Program will be held in a remote/hybrid work environment. 

  

Learn, Network, and Contribute 

A summer at Noblis is a summer well spent. If you are a student who is looking for good pay, valuable real-world experience, and the opportunity to grow, we are the place for you. Our interns spend their days collaborating with full-time staff and other interns to create innovative, mission-focused solutions for our clients’ most pressing problems. We offer a diverse network of professionals who each offer a unique skillset to shape your development. Read more about our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion initiative here.  

 

Build Your Real-World Experience 

When you intern for Noblis, we will offer real work on projects where you can learn, contribute, and see what it is like to be a working professional in your field. We will show belief in your potential through making you an integral part of our team from day one. We also facilitate group activities that allow you to meet other interns and form new connections. You will attend weekly seminars and networking events designed to prepare you for an impactful career. And you have the ability to join our Intern Mentorship Program. Above all, we will provide you with an environment that enables learning and growth. 

  

Invest in Your Future 

Your summer at Noblis will be challenging, educational, hands on, and memorable. You will leave prepared for life after school—as a leader, problem-solver, and critical thinker with real-world experience. And if you love your time at Noblis, you may have the opportunity to stay! A significant percentage of our interns become full-time employees. 

 

Join an Award-Winning Program

Noblis was awarded a Top 100 Internship Program Award from WayUp in 2020. Our program offers our interns an opportunity to participate in our Intern Mentorship Program, weekly lunch and learns, networking activities, technology book talks, employee resource groups, company-wide events and R&D projects, and presentations to our executive council.

  • A GPA of 3.3 or higher  
  • U.S. Citizenship or U.S. Permanent Residency status  
  • Demonstrated analytical skills, strong written and oral communication, and collaboration skills  
  • An interest and skill in any of the following:  
  • Computer Science  
  • Systems Engineering  
  • Cybersecurity  
  • Modeling and Simulation  
  • Biometric Technologies  
  • Life and Chemical/Biological Sciences  
  • Telecommunications  
  • Blockchain Technologies  
  • Data Analytics  
  • Corporate Business Operations (finance, accounting, human resources/organizational development, information technology, event planning/coordination, and marketing)

The Security and Access Management Intern assists Security Access Analysts in provisioning access to UnityPoint Health network resources and applications. Intern supports Analysts in applying proper permissions and troubleshoot problems relating to permissions, access, and workflow. Successful job performance results in efficient and effective access management systems, appropriate permissions, and excellent customer care.

Responsibilities:

Security & Access Management Intern

  • Efficiently and effectively manages user access to the UnityPoint Health network and applications, including processing new users, name changes, transfers, terminations, audit work, and other related items according to SLA requirements and company policies and procedures.
  • Works with Access Analysts to understand, apply and develop guidelines, policies, and procedures.
  • May assume additional responsibilities as directed by Department Manager/Supervisor
  • Process user accounts builds, access removal, and user account data management to service customers.

Security Tools/Systems/Process Documentation

  • Follow account/access rights procedures and guidelines for new applications and business environments.
  • Complies with security standards, policies and procedures by all areas of the organization. Reports non-adherence and material nonconformity to standards and policies.
  • Aids Supervisor and Analysts in implementing policies and operating practices.

Education:  

  • Currently enrolled as a student at a secondary educational institute.  
  • Computer Science and/or programming/development skills/experience a plus!

Experience:

  • Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and use of computer technology preferred
  • Any additional specialized experience with Epic or Active Directory

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Ability to perform multiple concurrent tasks subject to frequent change.

Description

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, modeling, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Mathematical modeling of transport processes and electrochemical behavior of Li-ion cells
  • Analyze experimental and simulation results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members

position: Frame Design Rule Checking - Fall 2021 Intern
description:
Frame Design Rule Checking - Fall 2021 Intern

Job Number:

 21005088
 

About GLOBALFOUNDRIES:

GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visitwww.globalfoundries.com.

Summary of Role: 

GLOBALFOUNDRIES Fab 8/9/10 Frame Team, which is part of the Tapeout organization, is seeking a talented and motivated person to join the team who is pursuing semiconductor product, design automation or software development skills.

The Tapeout organization is responsible for the successful delivery of photomasks to our wafer fabs. The delivery of photomasks involves several design and computational processes, one of which is the wafer inline process monitoring content (PCM) included in a physical structure known as the Frame which borders our customers designs. Designing of the Frame involves optical, electrical and physical structures that are translated onto each photomask level in parallel with the customers design and mask manufacturing content.

You will primarily be responsible for learning how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation to meet manufacturability criteria and then interpret as well as translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Frame Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool. Additionally, you may develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement. The technologies nodes may include Bulk, SOI, RF CMOS or other differentiated offerings. You will be a member of the broader Global Tapeout Operations team that produces masks encompassing both the Frame and product chip designs. Other tasks may include writing programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames in a quality manner. A person in this role will have the opportunity to interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers. The person in this role must be able to work effectively in a remote learning and work setting as your immediate Manager and your primary Mentor may reside at a different site than you will be located. This position is planned to be located at the GLOBALFOUNDRIES site in Austin, Texas.

The intern will have the opportunity to learn about a semiconductor Foundry’s Frame verification approach as well as at least one Design Rule Checking (DRC) methodology while gaining exposure to industry offered Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Learn how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation
  • Interpret and translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Design Rule Checking (DRC) deck
  • Develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement
  • Write programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames
  • Interact with interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers
  • Work effectively in a remote learning and work setting

Other Responsibilities:

  • Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs

Required Qualifications:

  • Enrolled in a BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science degree
  • Experience with Python or Shell Scripting
  • Experience using Cadence Virtuoso or an equivalent design layout tool
  • Experience using a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, such as Mentor Graphics Calibre
  • Fluency in English Language – written & verbal
  • Travel: 0-to-10% Travel required

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience coding a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, specifically Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf
  • Experience using Cadence Quickview or an equivalent design viewing tool
  • Experience using office productivity software tools (preferably Microsoft products)
  • Prior experience as an intern in the Semiconductor industry in a related role, such as PDK development or Tapeout with knowledge in related areas such as mask data preparation, inline metrology, reticle construction, testchips, reticle frame building, OPC or mask manufacturing
  • Familiar with Software Engineering with Programming Languages (Java, Perl) or scripting language (Korn Shell) on a Linux platform or relational database experience
  • Familiar with programming (React, JSP, Spring Framework, JavaScript/Dojo, LDAP, AJAX, Rest Services, JBoss, CSS and LSF)

position: SAP iXp Intern -Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing
description:
What we offer


Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!


SAP Internship Experience Program


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAPs global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP


1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.


2. Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.


3. Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, youll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


The intern for the SAP Digital Platforms Personalization & Dynamic Digital Marketing team will support SAPs digital mandate to make it easy to do business with SAP online by providing a relevant and engaging digital experience. The position will support the personalization program with analysis and reporting, project management, quality assurance, and communication. This role will work with many teams across the organization to assist in the global and regional execution and day-to-day operations to ensure the programs success.


Personalization & Dynamic Digital Marketing is on the cutting edge of B2B marketing and digital approaches to the customer journey. If you like forging new paths and have an entrepreneurial mindset, this internship will be a great opportunity.


Position title: SAP Intern Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing


Location: Newtown Square, PA please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings


Expected start date to end date: September 2021


In this role, youll:


+ Provide insightful web analytics to help better gauge the success of our programs, including pulling data, building new reports and dashboards, analyzing results, and segment construction.

+ Assist with project managing the personalization programs, including but not limited to tracking tasks, liaising with stakeholders, following up on deliverables, and ensuring deadlines are met.

+ Support the creation of new rule-based and machine learning personalization programs by participating in discussions, performing initial research, and planning process steps.

+ Manage and run the account listening program for global sales and marketing, monitoring activities for groups of accounts on SAP.com digital properties.

+ Responsible for testing and monitoring the personalization programs on the SAP web properties by applying quality assurance methods.

+ Maintaining the Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing teams content to drive awareness and transparency of the teams programs and offerings. Update the content on the site, write blog posts, monitor user-generated content, and suggest ways to make the site more of an effective tool in communicating the mission of the team.

+ Build thorough and well-designed PowerPoint presentations to educate audiences on upcoming or past personalization programs.

+ Other special projects and tasks as assigned.


Who you are:


Were looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


Skills / Competencies .


Web Analytics and Tech Competencies:


+ Experience with and interest in web reporting and analytics

+ Ability to articulate data stories to business audiences

+ Advanced level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint

+ Experience with Adobe Analytics preferred


Quality Assurance:


+ Detail-oriented

+ Commitment to accuracy


Communication and presentation skills:


+ Effective communication skills, both oral and written


Project Management:


+ Ability to work in a high-paced, dynamic environment, juggling multiple projects simultaneously

+ Experience with preparing meeting materials, taking comprehensive notes, and managing notifications/correspondence


General


+ Passion for technologyand a service-oriented mindset will be a major advantage in this role


Educational Requirements (degrees, class completion, etc.)


This position requires candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or Masters program which is applicable to the position. Seeking degrees in Information Management, Computer Science, Marketing, or General Business. Commensurate experience in digital marketing positions is a plus.


Qualifications:


+ Requires candidates to currently be enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters program which is applicable to the position

+ Experience with Adobe Analytics is a plus


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and dont miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


SAP DIVERSITY COMMITMENT


To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis


We are SAP


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.


Our inclusion promise


SAPs culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone regardless of background feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.


SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: Careers@sap.com .


EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.


Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Requisition ID:303863| Work Area: Administration| Expected Travel: 0 - 10%| Career Status: Student| Employment Type: Intern| Additional Locations:

Responsibilities

Noblis is looking for technical interns for our 2022 Summer Internship Program!

Our 2022 Program will be held in a remote/hybrid work environment. 

  

Learn, Network, and Contribute 

A summer at Noblis is a summer well spent. If you are a student who is looking for good pay, valuable real-world experience, and the opportunity to grow, we are the place for you. Our interns spend their days collaborating with full-time staff and other interns to create innovative, mission-focused solutions for our clients’ most pressing problems. We offer a diverse network of professionals who each offer a unique skillset to shape your development. Read more about our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion initiative here.  

 

Build Your Real-World Experience 

When you intern for Noblis, we will offer real work on projects where you can learn, contribute, and see what it is like to be a working professional in your field. We will show belief in your potential through making you an integral part of our team from day one. We also facilitate group activities that allow you to meet other interns and form new connections. You will attend weekly seminars and networking events designed to prepare you for an impactful career. And you have the ability to join our Intern Mentorship Program. Above all, we will provide you with an environment that enables learning and growth. 

  

Invest in Your Future 

Your summer at Noblis will be challenging, educational, hands on, and memorable. You will leave prepared for life after school—as a leader, problem-solver, and critical thinker with real-world experience. And if you love your time at Noblis, you may have the opportunity to stay! A significant percentage of our interns become full-time employees. 

 

Join an Award-Winning Program

Noblis was awarded a Top 100 Internship Program Award from WayUp in 2020. Our program offers our interns an opportunity to participate in our Intern Mentorship Program, weekly lunch and learns, networking activities, technology book talks, employee resource groups, company-wide events and R&D projects, and presentations to our executive council. 

Qualifications

What We Need From You: 

  • A GPA of 3.3 or higher  
  • U.S. Citizenship or U.S. Permanent Residency status  
  • Demonstrated analytical skills, strong written and oral communication, and collaboration skills  
  • An interest and skill in any of the following:  
  • Computer Science  
  • Systems Engineering  
  • Cybersecurity  
  • Modeling and Simulation  
  • Biometric Technologies  
  • Life and Chemical/Biological Sciences  
  • Telecommunications  
  • Blockchain Technologies  
  • Data Analytics  
  • Corporate Business Operations (finance, accounting, human resources/organizational development, information technology, event planning/coordination, and marketing)

Overview

Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiary, Noblis ESI, tackle the nation's toughest problems and apply advanced solutions to our clients' most critical missions. We bring the best of scientific thought, management and engineering expertise together in an environment of independence and objectivity to deliver enduring impact on federal missions. Noblis works with a wide range of government clients in the defense, intelligence and federal civil sectors. Learn more at Noblis -About Us

 

Why work at a Noblis company?

Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public. Noblis has won numerous workplace awards. Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace.

 

Noblis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race (as well as because of or on the basis of traits historically associated with race, including hair texture, hair type, and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions, genetic factors, military/veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.

Summary You will serve as an Engineer or Scientist in the Combat Systems Support Branch of NAVUNSEAWARCENDIV NEWPORT RI. This is a temporary reassignment opportunity, not to exceed one year and may be extended up to three years, located on-site at PMS 401 at the Washington Navy Yard, Washington DC. Responsibilities You will serve as a recognized authority and expert consultant for the development, test, evaluation, risk management, and program management of towed sensor systems, as well as DoD acquisition efforts for assigned systems You will establish, oversee, and control technical milestones, schedules, contracts, budgets, and costs in an effort to ensure project success. You will represent the activity on high-level committees and groups, and is recognized as the subject matter expert for assigned systems on-site. You will advise as a technical expert in towed arrays to advance the state of the art in towed arrays by leading and directing government acquisition teams. You will review all technical specifications, applying Systems Engineering rigor, review contractor deliverables and Engineering Change proposals, as well as the support of contracting actions and general procurement document Requirements Conditions of Employment Qualifications FOR ND-05 (GS-14/15 equivalent): In addition to the Basic Requirements for this position, your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to ND-05 in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: experience as a professional engineer or scientist leading the execution or direction of projects, systems development efforts, or research or technology initiatives related to sea warfare systems.. Additional qualification information can be found from the following Office of Personnel Management website: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=List-by-Occupational-Series https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=GS-PROF AND For the 0801 series: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0800/files/all-professional-engineering-positions-0800.pdf For the 1550 series: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/1500/computer-science-series-1550/ Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. Education Applicants must meet the following positive education qualifications requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual: Applicants must possess one or more of the following: For the ND-08XX, Professional Engineering Series. - successfully completed a bachelor's degree (or higher) in engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET); or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics. Such education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of the position. OR - combination of college-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following: (I) Professional registration or licensure: Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration; or (II) Written Test: Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination or any other written test required for professional registration by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico; or (III) Specified academic courses: Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and in engineering that included the courses specified in the basic requirements under paragraph A (above). The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program as described in paragraph A (above); or (IV) Related curriculum: Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a bachelor's degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least one year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily, there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions. For the ND-1550, Professional Computer Science Series. - bachelor's degree in computer science. - bachelor's or higher degree with 30 semester hours in a combination of mathematics, statistics, and computer science. At least 15 of my 30 semester hours were in a combination of statistics and mathematics that included differential and integral calculus. Additional Information This position is covered by the Department of Defense Priority Placement Program. Additional vacancies may be filled by this announcement. A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements, including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments. If you are unable to apply online and request information about the Alternate Application process, please contact the Department of Navy's Employment Information Center. Federal annuitant information: The selection of an annuitant is subject to the Department of Defense and Department of the Navy policy on the employment of annuitants. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf Temporary appointments may be extended up to 3 years at the discretion of management and in accordance with applicable regulations. ICTAP Applicants: To be considered well-qualified and exercise selection priority as an ICTAP candidate, displaced Federal employees must satisfy all qualification requirements for the position and receive a rating in the highly qualified category (score 85) or higher. ICTAP candidates must provide copies of all of the following documentation at the time of application: 1) agency notice; 2) most recent performance appraisal; and 3) most recent SF-50 or notification of personnel action that includes position, grade level, and duty location. Applicants who do not provide this documentation will not receive consideration as an ICTAP candidate. For more information about ICTAP eligibility please review the following link: https://www.usajobs.gov/Help/working-in-government/unique-hiring-paths/federal-employees/ictap/ Military Spouse Preference applicants will receive priority consideration at the Full Performance Level (FPL) and if determined to be Best Qualified at the FPL, and selected, must be placed at the FPL. A BQ military spouse possesses knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies comparable to others who meet the competitive referral criteria for the specific position.

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, modeling, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Mathematical modeling of transport processes and electrochemical behavior of Li-ion cells
  • Analyze experimental and simulation results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
  • Work closely with the battery development and test team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in physics-based modeling of electrochemical or general transport processes
  • Preferred: Experience with multiphysics simulations in COMSOL
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous: Experience with Python and/or MATLAB

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

The intern student will conduct leading research and develop algorithms, system solutions, and/or open source prototypes in the fields of video communications, video processing, and/or AR/VR technologies. The intern will have the opportunity to work alongside senior researchers to help explore and develop new and impactful multimedia applications and technologies. Strong candidate will be able to contribute to patents and publications. We are looking for self-motivated Ph.D. students who are passionate about new technology innovations and with appropriate skills and knowledge in relevant fields.

 

Requirements:                                                                                       
  • Deep knowledge and hands-on experience in video communication, video processing, AR VR, or computer vision algorithms.
  • Strong programming skills in python or C / C++ for Windows and/or Linux
  • Experience in working with open-source software frameworks is a plus
  • Good communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ph.D in Computer Science / Electrical Engineering, or related technical disciplines.
